abstract: Google is making it harder for business owners to track how someone gets to a Web site. But there are things an owner can do.
snippet: Google is making it harder for business owners to track how someone gets to a Web site. But there are things an owner can do.
lead_paragraph: Google recently switched to something known as secure search, limiting the data that can be seen using its analytics. This means Web site owners and managers can no longer see the string of words used by an individual to find their site in a search, which could have a profound effect on marketing efforts. Knowing how customers found them helps business owners optimize their sites so that they rank higher in search results.

headline.main: How Google’s Search Changes Affect Small Businesses
